'''Dave Peabody''' (born '''David Peabody''', 20 April 1948, [[Southall]], [[Middlesex]], [[London]], [[England]]) is an [[English people|English]] [[singer-songwriter]], [[blues]] and [[folk music|folk]] [[musician]], [[record producer]] and [[photographer]], active since the late 1960s, who has appeared on more than 60 [[album]]s.<ref name="AMG">{{cite web |first= |last=|url={{Allmusic|class=artist|id=p19802/biography|pure_url=yes}}|title=Biography by Richard Skelly |publisher=Allmusic.com |accessdate=30 November 2009}}</ref>  He is primarily known for his acoustic guitar playing, in both [[Slide guitar|bottleneck]] and [[fingerpicking]] styles.

==Career==
He first recorded in 1971 as a member of a group, Polly Flosskin, who recorded an album, ''Sailin' on the Ocean,'' and then as a member of a successor group, Tight Like That, on the [[The Village Thing|Village Thing]] label.<ref name=wirz>{{cite web|url=http://www.wirz.de/music/peabofrm.htm|title=Dave Peabody discography|publisher=Wirz.de|accessdate=2014-01-26}}</ref>  He also performed with early versions of [[Savoy Brown]] and [[Fleetwood Mac]].<ref name="AMG"/>  His first, self-titled, solo album was released in 1973.  In all, he has released nine solo albums, the most recent being ''Side by Slide'' in 2005.  He has also performed and recorded with a wide variety of other blues musicians, notably [[Charlie Musselwhite]] and [[Big Joe Duskin]], as well as in a duo with [[Bob Hall (musician)|Bob Hall]], and has appeared at many blues festivals in the US and in Europe.<ref name="AMG"/>

In 1996, he replaced [[Paul King (musician)|Paul King]] in the King Earl Boogie Band.  Peabody was voted "Acoustic Blues Artist of the Year" in 1995, 2001 and 2002.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kebb.co.uk/Who.htm |title=KEBB_introducing |publisher=Kebb.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2014-01-26}}</ref>

==Discography==

===Solo===
*''Peabody Hotel'' (1973) - [[The Village Thing]]
*''Keep It Clean'' (1974) - Matchbox Records
*''Come and Get It'' (1976) - Matchbox Records
*''Blues in Brussels'' (1977) - CL Records
*''Payday'' (1979) - Waterfront Records
*''Americana'' (1987) - Waterfront Records
*''Hands Across The Sea'' (1993) - Appaloosa Records
*''Down in Carolina'' (1997) - Appaloosa Records
*''Side by Slide'' (2005) - Appaloosa Records
<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/dave-peabody-mn0000962983/discography |title=Dave Peabody | Discography |publisher=AllMusic |date=1948-04-20 |accessdate=2014-01-26}}</ref>

===With Bob Hall===
*''Down The Road Apiece'' (1981) - Appaloosa Records
*''Roll and Slide'' (1984) - Appaloosa Records

===With Brendan Power===
*''Two Trains Running'' (2000) - Indigo Records

===With The King Earl Boogie Band===
*''Loaded and Live'' (2009) - Angel Air Records

===With Colin Earl===
*''Frets & Keys'' (2009) - Valve Records
